comments.body: Using sha1 because that is what is available from the download site.
You can download the tarball and compute the sha256 yourself, though....
Sure, but isn't it safer and more efficient to use the one published by in the download site?
Not really.  It doesn't really matter who computes the original hash as long as it is correct.

- MPL is not a valid license family, so I am using OTHER.
  - The license file is not included in the tarball

Under the terms of the license, the source code must be included along with the executable:

```
such Covered Software must also be made available in Source Code Form, as described in Section 3.1, 
and You must inform recipients of the Executable Form how they can obtain a copy of such Source Code 
Form by reasonable means in a timely manner, at a charge no more than the cost of distribution to the recipient; 
```

Okay, but it isn't... so how should we proceed? Keep two things in mind:

 - "go" source code with vendor dependencies is usually pretty big
 - the dev-url is pointing to the GitHub page, so they can obtain the source code without any cost.
Actually, negate this.  "made available" does not mean "distribute".  The dev-url should be enough.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +27,31 @@  home: https://www.joyent.com/containerpilot
  license: MPL-2.0
  license_family: OTHER
  summary: 'A service for autodiscovery and configuration of applications running in containers'
